quizzes.question: General HTML elements consist of:
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]HTML Elements [/h1] HTML documents are made up of HTML elements. An HTML element is written using a [b]start tag[/b] and an [b]end tag[/b], and with the [b]content [/b]in between. HTML documents consist of nested HTML elements. In the example below, the body element includes the

tags, the
tag and the content, "This is a paragraph". [code format="html" codeId="13"] first page

This is a paragraph

[/code] [note]Some HTML elements (like the [b]
[/b] tag) do not have end tags.[/note]

quizzes.question: Fill in the blanks: [!html!] {0}Title{1}</head> <body> <p>Some text</p> </body> </html>
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]HTML Elements [/h1] Some elements are quite small. Since you can't put contents within a break tag, and you don't have an opening and closing break tag, itâ€™s a separate, single element. So HTML is really scripting with elements within elements. [code format="html" codeId="14"] first page

This is a paragraph

This is a
line break

[/code]
